CONJUGATES: uprights (n, pl) | more upright (adj) | most upright (adj) | uprightly (adv) | uprightness (n)
ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English, derived from 'up' + 'right', meaning literally 'straight up' or 'erect'.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Standing or extending straight up; vertical or erect.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She adjusted the cushion so she could sit more upright.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她调整了坐垫，以便能坐得更直一些。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Strictly honorable, honest, or respectable; characterized by moral integrity.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He was considered a thoroughly upright businessman who never cheated his partners.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他被认为是一个非常正直的商人，从不欺骗他的合作伙伴。

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A vertical post or structure, especially one forming a support or part of a frame.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The frame of the shed was constructed using four main uprights.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 棚子的框架是用四根主要的立柱搭建的。

REGISTER: General usage, often found in formal or technical contexts when referring to morality or structure.
